items.text: tossed up on middle and leg, played off the front foot to wide long on
full on middle and leg, turning into Tamim, worked off his pads to square leg
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, rocks back and punches off the back foot to the bowler
items.shortText: Cremer to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: down the wicket, and converts this into a full toss. Muscled over the bowler to long on
full and wide outside off, tries to cut behind square but doesn't have the direction. Straight to point
back of a length outside off, angling into the right hander, driven to mid off. But can't find the gap
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: good length outside off, angling into the batsman again. Flicked off his pads to deep backward square
back of a length on leg stump, tapped to square leg for a quick single. Late response from Tamim for the single, but they scamper through eventually
full outside off, charges down the ground and tries to slog. Takes the inside edge and onto his pads
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, extra pace off the surface! Zips past his outside edge as the batsman tries to play off the back foot
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Tamim on 5999 runs. One run away from being the first Bangladesh batsman to 6000 ODI runs.
items.text: tossed up on off stump, driven to wide long on and there's the 6000th run for Tamim Iqbal in ODIs!
items.postText: Applause from the players, staff, and the fans.

items.text: full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg

dismissal.text: Mushfiqur Rahim c Muzarabani b Cremer 18 (25b 0x4 1x6) SR: 72.00

items.preText: Kasun Suraj: "If Bdesh loose today match to Zim and if SL won the match on 25th with the bonus point, it will be fine for SL. But, if Bdesh win todays game with or without bonus point, oh boy we will have a SL must win match on 25th. Or we will see all the dramas for the NRR."
items.text: tossed up full on off stump, driven firmly back past the bowler to mid off
back of a length outside off, stays low, cut off the back foot to cover
full on middle stump, it's a low full toss, tapped back to the bowler
full outside off, spins away from him, opens the bat's face and nudges it to point
good length on middle stump, angling away from Tamim. Pokes at it, and plays it with the bat's open face to point
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and slow outside off, and it's smacked over the bowler's head! Beats mid off, and races away to the long-off boundary
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: short on middle stump, but soars over the batsman's head. Good, effort delivery, but too high
good length on middle stump, glanced off the back foot to third man

items.preText: Simba: "250 should be enough to see off a shaky Zim batting lineup. And from the looks of things Bangladesh will likely get more than 250 with ease!" -- I wouldn't be too sure. Zimbabwe have looked solid all series, except for that one blip. 250 is par
items.text: back of a length outside off, fishes at it and plays it to point with soft hands. Calls for an early single, and easily completed
good length on off stump, once again Tamim opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man
back of a length wide outside off, guided off the back foot to the right-hander's third man on this occasion. Time for drinks
items.postText:
Thanks, Sreshth. Will Bangladesh push for 270? It's not easy to hit out on this pitch.

Varun Shetty's back to take you through till the 50th over.

items.text: trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
items.shortText: Cremer to Sabbir Rahman, no run
